about_the_game:
You received an invitation to the renowned estate of Count Aegir. The eccentric inventor wishes to unveil his latest creation, claiming it to be his greatest one yet. Taking on the role of Loki, god of lies, you encounter a diverse cast of Germanic deities as you navigate the strange mansion.

Things soon get interesting, as the mansion itself rises from the ground and starts moving, subsequently trapping the visitors inside. Further complication arises, when the count is found unconscious and the mansion's control device is missing. Now it is up to Loki to find the culprit.Can the god of lies uncover the truth?

Meet Germanic deities

On your quest to catch the assailant, you will have to interrogate and communicate with an array of Germanic gods and goddesses. Listen carefully to what they say, as even the innocent ones have plenty of secrets to discover. But be careful, or you might reveal things about yourself you rather had kept hidden.




Explore the wandering Mansion

The crime takes place in a walking mansion, reminiscent of a giant mechanical octopus. You get to explore it's many nautical themed rooms via point and click mechanic. It pays to be thorough, as there are many secrets hiding in every corner.





May the odds be in your favour!

The "Maritime Mecha Mystery" adds a layer of excitement and challenge via occasional dice rolls to determine the outcome of decisions. This mechanic is based on the simple and free "Rookie's Die" pen-and-paper tabletop RPG rule system.

You can tweak your odds a little by customizing Loki's stats before each playthrough. This way, no two adventures are the same.
